>Useful tips before posting:
•If you're a reader post that you're offering readings and what information is required from the querent; same goes for trading.
•Post the sexes of yourself and the people involved if your query when asking for a reading
•Look for posts to determine if there's an active reader, what's needed and before posting, check if they finished reading already.
•Some readers will refuse to do certain readings - respect that choice. Do harass readers if your query is refused/skipped.
•Traders should respect that a traded read will be granted, as per an agreement of trade. Free readers have the option of picking their queries.
•Bullshit queries will get bullshit answers. Same for vague queries.
•Making an AQ (air query) by not addressing a reader, in particular, is possible but doesn't guarantee an answer.
•Avoid making the same query repeatedly and/or to different readers in a short period of time, as this may lead to more confusion.
•Provide feedback when applicable and be considerate to the reader. We're a growing community, many readers are starting and need to know what they are doing right or wrong. Let's help each other to improve.

FAQ:
>Can anyone have an out of body experience?
Yes, this is a natural part of being human that has been mostly forgotten.

>Is it not just a vivid lucid dream?
No. A successful astral projection feels just as, often even more real than the waking reality you're experiencing right now.

>Does it have to be difficult and take me months or more to attain this ability?
No, the only barrier is your mind - both conscious and subconscious. If you think it's going to be difficult, it will. Many people can be successful within their first few tries. Fear can hold you back.

>Do I have to come back from shifting?
No.

>Is Astral Projection Dangerous?
The only way it can be dangerous is if you believe it to be, and even then only to your mental state. You cannot be physically harmed.

No, we have four terrestiral planets to look at. Two have no moon, one nas one moon, one has two moons. threads.sub: Why can't we see those dang supernatural critters? (1/3)
threads.com:
I want you all to think about this and I mean really think: why can't we see those damn supernatural creatures even though we've had references, stories, and reoccurring paranormal imagery for literal centuries? I have a theory: our cameras.

You know how it's weird how something so mysterious and impossible somehow only gets caught on shitty cam footage and all the 4k resolution or whatever never gets one? Well, have we ever thought about why that is? Sure, cameras can carry an unusual energy given, at least the analog ones, they're mirrors bouncing light onto tape. For so long, we only had the art of others to describe what these creatures look like as they had an easier time getting away with it during those years. Ever since cameras came into the picture, they've gone further into hiding and things only got worse for them since we invented video cameras. However, if we have this technology now, the fancy shit that allows us to view infrared, heat seeking, or downright nightvision, why can't we still see them? That's the issue itself: what we have made now is so far removed from analog cameras and early forms of filming (90s camcorders and VHS recorders) that they probably no longer carry that same unknowable energy as their ancestor tech.

So what am I thinking? Older forms of filming, from 16 mm film to early camcorders, probably contain that sweet spot of being able to view the supernatural movement while not being so removed from the energy older cameras. Has anyone noticed when you feel "different" when you hold this tech? Sure, it feels weird and alien because its old, but really analyze those feelings. Why do you feel strange? Why does it seem unusual when it's just an ordinary camcorder? It has to be that sweet spot energy of old and new. It pretty much explains why some of the most "plausible" or "unusual" footage of supernatural events online are viewed through the most God awful cameras in the world.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
(2/3)
Of course, some parts of the world are behind in tech which could be one explanation, but who would have a shitty enough phone or camcorder in this day and age? Not a lot, so I propose a secondary offshoot to this theory.

Again, think about it, the most plausible videos that contain supernatural events tend to be so low quality you can't even understand what you're looking at? The issue is that these creatures obviously hide themselves in some sort of other dimension that we can't perceive. However, if they are spotted, what would be the best option for them? Teleport? Memory wipe? No, blur our cameras and dawdle. If they don't do anything abnormal and act like some blur among the blurs, then a lot of people can easily dismiss it as a fake or "unusual footage." The ultimate counter to this would be multiple cameras, but who's to say they're strong enough to turn off all of them or blur them all conveniently? Wouldn't that alarm us to their existence? Yes, so they stay in their separate dimension we can't see to travel and only come out to possibly collect a few resources only found in our world. God knows what they are because we never see them for too long. Then again, who knows why they come out all if there's more risk than gain? Whatever they're doing, if they go into areas where they know they're going to possibly confront humans, it's better to go into areas that either aren't technologically advanced or have weak hardware that can be easily manipulated. Can't call the footage real if there's an air of deniability from the blurry footage that the "creature" might be cgi. So how can we ever truly tell? Perhaps get enough cameras to take footage of both the screen and the distance where the creature can be seen?
